channel.title: Comments on: What the Bleep is Docker?

item.title: By: 7.15 Docker – 全栈Python
item.dc:creator: 7.15 Docker – 全栈Python
item.description: […] What the Bleep is Docker? is a plain English explanation with examples of what Docker provides and what it can be used for in your environment. […]
item.content:encoded: […] What the Bleep is Docker? is a plain English explanation with examples of what Docker provides and what it can be used for in your environment. […]

item.title: By: sebastian
item.dc:creator: sebastian
item.description: they are closed source opengl heavy apps with command line interfaces for headless graphcs rendering
item.content:encoded: they are closed source opengl heavy apps with command line interfaces for headless graphcs rendering

item.title: By: Shantnu
item.dc:creator: Shantnu
item.description:
Yes, it uses Virtualbox, but adds a lot of cool features. Like, you can script the Virtual machine bringup. So that all you need to do is type <i> vagrant up</i> and you will get the exact same VM as me.
Also, if you are using, say Windows, you can continue using your favorite editor, while still developing in Linux.
Vagrant has completely changed the VM game. Give it a try- it's quiet easy to get started with.
item.content:encoded:
Yes, it uses Virtualbox, but adds a lot of cool features. Like, you can script the Virtual machine bringup. So that all you need to do is type vagrant up and you will get the exact same VM as me.

Also, if you are using, say Windows, you can continue using your favorite editor, while still developing in Linux.

Vagrant has completely changed the VM game. Give it a try- it’s quiet easy to get started with.

item.title: By: Clark
item.dc:creator: Clark
item.description: But it still needs to be run in something like virtualbox correct? So is it basically setting up your virtual machine and getting it to a development usable state?
item.content:encoded: But it still needs to be run in something like virtualbox correct? So is it basically setting up your virtual machine and getting it to a development usable state?

item.content:encoded: Depends. Are you compiling these apps from source, or are you just downloading them?

item.title: By: Shantnu
item.dc:creator: Shantnu
item.description:
Vagrant is a very easy way to run Virtual Machines.
https://www.vagrantup.com/
Nowadays, I would always use a Vagrant if I needed a VM.
item.content:encoded:
Vagrant is a very easy way to run Virtual Machines.

https://www.vagrantup.com/

Nowadays, I would always use a Vagrant if I needed a VM.

item.title: By: sebastian
item.dc:creator: sebastian
item.description: Hey, interesting writeup, do you have any experience dockerising apps like Maya or Nuke and their environments? Does it make sense?
item.content:encoded: Hey, interesting writeup, do you have any experience dockerising apps like Maya or Nuke and their environments? Does it make sense?
